function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Error accumulation in sensor-only method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited testing and treatment capabilities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of new cases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of mild or asymptomatic cases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited accuracy and specificity of biomarker measurements","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of qualified staff for testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misdiagnosis and fake news","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misdiagnoses, privacy breaches, equipment malfunction, costs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact on information technology, media, and research & development","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in customer needs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Herd immunity and vaccine effectiveness in ageing populations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges faced by construction industry stakeholders due to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Professionals may not prioritize occupant health in building design and operation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of highly infectious airborne virus","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality due to pollutants such as volatile organic compounds, carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide, and particulates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of focus on ventilation and indoor air quality, exacerbated by the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to musculoskeletal pain and mental health issues related to building design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to sick building syndrome symptoms like red/watery eyes, runny/blocked nose, itchy/dry throat and skin.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low level of experience in improving occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health issues persist with degraded ieq in building types","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate building design for occupant health","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective use of wearable sensors ws leading to limited disease monitoring and control.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on large-scale datasets for ai models, which may not always be available or reliable.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of incorporation of domain knowledge in data-driven ai models leading to suboptimal performance in disease monitoring and control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of common standards and guidelines for evaluating healthy building design, construction, and operation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of new standards and guidelines.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emergency preparedness guidelines for buildings in extreme events, such as infectious disease pandemics.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of voice-activated interfaces may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases by facilitating surface contact.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial arrangements and movement restrictions may lead to crowding and increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ventilating/cleaning clothes worn outside, washing hands with soap for a long time, and ventilating spaces are important measures to reduce the risk of covid-19 transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as places for communication and social activities may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases between neighbors and residents.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of balconies for daily activities like drying laundry and storing items can potentially spread contaminants or pathogens in the air or on surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cooperation and interaction in residential balconies can lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and air circulation on the balcony can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of privacy on the balcony may lead to behaviors that increase the risk of disease transmission, such as talking loudly and playing loud music.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of environmental conditions and surface temperature on virus activity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Graphene oxide go and reduced graphene oxide rgo contain oxygen functional groups hydroxyl, carboxyl, carbonyl, and epoxy that affect their physicochemical properties.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with larger lateral size have stronger adsorption ability, which affects the physicochemical interaction with microorganisms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased number of graphene layers can weaken the antimicrobial activity and cause increased aggregation tendency.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
